task.summary:
Add database models, Dockerfile, and .dockerignore
This commit introduces models for a database, including classes for Invoices, Orders, Products, and Users. It also establishes relationships between these entities. Additionally, it creates a Dockerfile to containerize the application, and a .dockerignore file to specify which files Docker should ignore.

Refactor code and add new functionalities
In this commit, unnecessary files were removed, namespaces were updated accordingly for database models, and various new files and functionalities were added. New functionalities include the addition of services for dependency injection, configurations, models for DTO responses, and methods related to users. Also, references to essential packages were added to various project files.

Add UserController, BaseController, and related files
Created BaseController and UserController in the API with corresponding methods and responses. Added a UserRequest model for handling user requests. Extended IUserService with required methods. Implemented these methods in UserService. Added necessary packages in Utilities project file. Updated namespaces in CommonExtensions file.

Add Role Assignment Repository and enhance authorization
This commit includes the addition of UserRoleAssignmentRepository under Componentes.Data and its corresponding interface, allowing role assignment creation and querying. Also, it has implemented enhancements in user authorization where some routes in UserController are marked with Authorization attributes. Unnecessary classes (Class1.cs) under Componentes.Core and Componentes.Data are removed. Overall, this commit provides necessary updates for better role management and security in the application.

Add 'GetAllUsers' endpoint and adjust JSON property naming
A new endpoint 'GetAllUsers' was added to the UserController to fetch all user data. Accompanying changes include augmenting the IUserService and IUserRepository with corresponding methods. Additionally, JsonProperty attributes were added to UserDto to ensure correct JSON naming conventions. Other minor adjustments include changing the Origin URL in IocExtension and slightly modifying the JWT claim names on token generation.

Update JWT authentication and validation logic
The JWT authentication and validation logic has been revised to improve security. This includes the addition of a procedure to verify issuer signing keys and adjusting the Token Validation Parameters to verify token components such as Issuer, Audience, and Lifetime. Error handling has also been improved for cases when token validation fails.

Update JWT token generation method parameters
Updated the GenerateJwtToken method in CommonExtensions class to improve code readability. The method now takes JWT config and UserDto as parameters directly instead of a JwTokenRequest object. This simplifies the function signature and makes it more intuitive. Also, AuthService is adjusted accordingly to pass the parameters directly.

MESSAGE.value:
Add database models, Dockerfile, and .dockerignore
This commit introduces models for a database, including classes for Invoices, Orders, Products, and Users. It also establishes relationships between these entities. Additionally, it creates a Dockerfile to containerize the application, and a .dockerignore file to specify which files Docker should ignore.

Refactor code and add new functionalities
In this commit, unnecessary files were removed, namespaces were updated accordingly for database models, and various new files and functionalities were added. New functionalities include the addition of services for dependency injection, configurations, models for DTO responses, and methods related to users. Also, references to essential packages were added to various project files.

Add UserController, BaseController, and related files
Created BaseController and UserController in the API with corresponding methods and responses. Added a UserRequest model for handling user requests. Extended IUserService with required methods. Implemented these methods in UserService. Added necessary packages in Utilities project file. Updated namespaces in CommonExtensions file.

Remove unused classes and add application host configuration
Deleted two unused classes Class1.cs from Componentes.Core and Componentes.Data. Added applicationhost.config under .idea/config to define IIS configuration sections and related settings - a crucial step towards enhancing the application performance and security.

Add Role Assignment Repository and enhance authorization
This commit includes the addition of UserRoleAssignmentRepository under Componentes.Data and its corresponding interface, allowing role assignment creation and querying. Also, it has implemented enhancements in user authorization where some routes in UserController are marked with Authorization attributes. Unnecessary classes (Class1.cs) under Componentes.Core and Componentes.Data are removed. Overall, this commit provides necessary updates for better role management and security in the application.

Add 'GetAllUsers' endpoint and adjust JSON property naming
A new endpoint 'GetAllUsers' was added to the UserController to fetch all user data. Accompanying changes include augmenting the IUserService and IUserRepository with corresponding methods. Additionally, JsonProperty attributes were added to UserDto to ensure correct JSON naming conventions. Other minor adjustments include changing the Origin URL in IocExtension and slightly modifying the JWT claim names on token generation.

Update JWT authentication and validation logic
The JWT authentication and validation logic has been revised to improve security. This includes the addition of a procedure to verify issuer signing keys and adjusting the Token Validation Parameters to verify token components such as Issuer, Audience, and Lifetime. Error handling has also been improved for cases when token validation fails.

Update JWT token generation method parameters
Updated the GenerateJwtToken method in CommonExtensions class to improve code readability. The method now takes JWT config and UserDto as parameters directly instead of a JwTokenRequest object. This simplifies the function signature and makes it more intuitive. Also, AuthService is adjusted accordingly to pass the parameters directly.
